name: cloudflare
description:
A Pulumi package for creating and managing Cloudflare cloud resources.

> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi/pulumi-cloudflare` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-cloudflare/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare` repo](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare/issues).

accountId.description: Configure API client to always use that account.

apiClientLogging.description: Whether to print logs from the API client (using the default log library logger)

apiUserServiceKey.description: A special Cloudflare API key good for a restricted set of endpoints.

maxBackoff.description: Maximum backoff period in seconds after failed API calls

minBackoff.description: Minimum backoff period in seconds after failed API calls

retries.description: Maximum number of retries to perform when an API request fails

rps.description: RPS limit to apply when making calls to the API

target.description: The request property to target. Allowed values: "ip", "ip6", "ip_range", "asn", "country"

value.description: The value to target. Depends on target's type.

bundleMethod.description: Method of building intermediate certificate chain. A ubiquitous bundle has the highest probability of being verified everywhere, even by clients using outdated or unusual trust stores. An optimal bundle uses the shortest chain and newest intermediates. And the force bundle verifies the chain, but does not otherwise modify it. Valid values are `ubiquitous` (default), `optimal`, `force`.

geoRestrictions.description: Specifies the region where your private key can be held locally. Valid values are `us`, `eu`, `highest_security`.

type.description: Whether to enable support for legacy clients which do not include SNI in the TLS handshake. Valid values are `legacy_custom` (default), `sni_custom`.

values.description: A list of string values for the header.

address.description: The IP address (IPv4 or IPv6) of the origin, or the publicly addressable hostname. Hostnames entered here should resolve directly to the origin, and not be a hostname proxied by Cloudflare.

enabled.description: Whether to enable (the default) this origin within the Pool. Disabled origins will not receive traffic and are excluded from health checks. The origin will only be disabled for the current pool.

name.description: A human-identifiable name for the origin.

weight.description: The weight (0.01 - 1.00) of this origin, relative to other origins in the pool. Equal values mean equal weighting. A weight of 0 means traffic will not be sent to this origin, but health is still checked. Default: 1.

poolIds.description: A list of pool IDs in failover priority to use for traffic reaching the given PoP.

pop.description: A 3-letter code for the Point-of-Presence. Allowed values can be found in the list of datacenters on the [status page](https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/). Multiple entries should not be specified with the same PoP.

poolIds.description: A list of pool IDs in failover priority to use for traffic reaching the given PoP.

region.description: A region code which must be in the list defined [here](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000540888-Load-Balancing-Geographic-Regions). Multiple entries should not be specified with the same region.

alwaysUseHttps.description: Boolean of whether this action is enabled. Default: false.

browserCacheTtl.description: The Time To Live for the browser cache. `0` means 'Respect Existing Headers'

bypassCacheOnCookie.description: String value of cookie name to conditionally bypass cache the page.

cacheLevel.description: Whether to set the cache level to `"bypass"`, `"basic"`, `"simplified"`, `"aggressive"`, or `"cache_everything"`.

cacheOnCookie.description: String value of cookie name to conditionally cache the page.

disableApps.description: Boolean of whether this action is enabled. Default: false.

disablePerformance.description: Boolean of whether this action is enabled. Default: false.

disableRailgun.description: Boolean of whether this action is enabled. Default: false.

disableSecurity.description: Boolean of whether this action is enabled. Default: false.

edgeCacheTtl.description: The Time To Live for the edge cache.

explicitCacheControl.description: Whether origin Cache-Control action is `"on"` or `"off"`.

forwardingUrl.description: The URL to forward to, and with what status. See below.

hostHeaderOverride.description: Value of the Host header to send.

minifies.description: The configuration for HTML, CSS and JS minification. See below for full list of options.

rocketLoader.description: Whether to set the rocket loader to `"on"`, `"off"`.

securityLevel.description: Whether to set the security level to `"off"`, `"essentially_off"`, `"low"`, `"medium"`, `"high"`, or `"under_attack"`.

ssl.description: Whether to set the SSL mode to `"off"`, `"flexible"`, `"full"`, `"strict"`, or `"origin_pull"`.

statusCode.description: The status code to use for the redirection.

url.description: The URL to which the page rule should forward.

css.description: Whether CSS should be minified. Valid values are `"on"` or `"off"`.

html.description: Whether HTML should be minified. Valid values are `"on"` or `"off"`.

js.description: Whether Javascript should be minified. Valid values are `"on"` or `"off"`.

mode.description: The type of action to perform. Allowable values are 'simulate', 'ban', 'challenge' and 'js_challenge'.

response.description: Custom content-type and body to return, this overrides the custom error for the zone. This field is not required. Omission will result in default HTML error page. Definition below.

timeout.description: The time in seconds as an integer to perform the mitigation action. This field is required if the `mode` is either `simulate` or `ban`. Must be the same or greater than the period (min: 1, max: 86400).

body.description: The body to return, the content here should conform to the content_type.

contentType.description: The content-type of the body, must be one of: 'text/plain', 'text/xml', 'application/json'.

by.description: If set to 'nat', NAT support will be enabled for rate limiting.

request.description: Matches HTTP requests (from the client to Cloudflare). See definition below.

response.description: Custom content-type and body to return, this overrides the custom error for the zone. This field is not required. Omission will result in default HTML error page. Definition below.

methods.description: HTTP Methods, can be a subset ['POST','PUT'] or all ['\_ALL\_']. Default: ['\_ALL\_'].

schemes.description: HTTP Schemes, can be one ['HTTPS'], both ['HTTP','HTTPS'] or all ['\_ALL\_'].  Default: ['\_ALL\_'].

urlPattern.description: The URL pattern to match comprised of the host and path, i.e. example.org/path. Wildcard are expanded to match applicable traffic, query strings are not matched. Use * for all traffic to your zone. Default: '*'.

originTraffic.description: Only count traffic that has come from your origin servers. If true, cached items that Cloudflare serve will not count towards rate limiting. Default: `true`.

statuses.description: HTTP Status codes, can be one [403], many [401,403] or indicate all by not providing this value.

name.description: The name of the record
Fully qualified domain name of the origin e.g. origin-ssh.example.com.

type.description: The type of DNS record associated with the application. Valid values: `CNAME`.

name.description: Fully qualified domain name of the origin e.g. origin-ssh.example.com.
The name for the binding.

target.description: The request property to target. Allowed values: "ip", "ip_range"

value.description: The value to target. Depends on target's type. IP addresses should just be standard IPv4/IPv6 notation i.e. `198.51.100.4` or `2001:db8::/32` and IP ranges in CIDR format i.e. `198.51.0.0/16`.

tls12Only.deprecationMessage: tls_1_2_only has been deprecated in favour of using `min_tls_version = "1.2"` instead.
tls_1_2_only has been deprecated in favour of using `min_tls_version = "1.2"` instead.

provider.description:
The provider type for the cloudflare package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare/blob/master/website/docs/index.html.markdown.

accountId.description: Configure API client to always use that account.

apiClientLogging.description: Whether to print logs from the API client (using the default log library logger)

apiUserServiceKey.description: A special Cloudflare API key good for a restricted set of endpoints.

maxBackoff.description: Maximum backoff period in seconds after failed API calls

minBackoff.description: Minimum backoff period in seconds after failed API calls

retries.description: Maximum number of retries to perform when an API request fails

rps.description: RPS limit to apply when making calls to the API

aud.description: Application Audience (AUD) Tag of the application

domain.description:
The complete URL of the asset you wish to put
Cloudflare Access in front of. Can include subdomains or paths. Or both.

name.description: Friendly name of the Access Application.

sessionDuration.description:
How often a user will be forced to
re-authorise. Must be one of `30m`, `6h`, `12h`, `24h`, `168h`, `730h`.

zoneId.description: The DNS zone to which the access rule should be added.

The complete URL of the asset you wish to put
Cloudflare Access in front of. Can include subdomains or paths. Or both.

name.description: Friendly name of the Access Application.

sessionDuration.description:
How often a user will be forced to
re-authorise. Must be one of `30m`, `6h`, `12h`, `24h`, `168h`, `730h`.

zoneId.description: The DNS zone to which the access rule should be added.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering AccessApplication resources.

The complete URL of the asset you wish to put
Cloudflare Access in front of. Can include subdomains or paths. Or both.

cloudflare:index/accessGroup:AccessGroup.description:
Provides a Cloudflare Access Group resource. Access Groups are used
in conjunction with Access Policies to restrict access to a
particular resource based on group membership.

## Conditions

`require`, `exclude` and `include` arguments share the available
conditions which can be applied. The conditions are:

* `ip` - (Optional) A list of IP addresses or ranges. Example:
  `ip = ["1.2.3.4", "10.0.0.0/2"]`
* `email` - (Optional) A list of email addresses. Example:
  `email = ["test@example.com"]`
* `email_domain` - (Optional) A list of email domains. Example:
  `email_domain = ["example.com"]`
* `everyone` - (Optional) Boolean indicating permitting access for all
  requests. Example: `everyone = true`

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare/blob/master/website/docs/r/access_group.html.markdown.

accountId.description:
The ID of the account the group is
associated with.

excludes.description:

full list.

includes.description:
A series of access conditions, see below for
full list.

full list.

`"facebook"`, `"google-apps"`, `"oidc"`, `"github"`, `"google"`, `"saml"`,
`"linkedin"`, `"azureAD"`, `"okta"`, `"onetimepin"`, `"onelogin"`, `"yandex"`.

cloudflare:index/accessPolicy:AccessPoli.description:
Provides a Cloudflare Access Policy resource. Access Policies are used
in conjunction with Access Applications to restrict access to a
particular resource.

## Conditions

`require`, `exclude` and `include` arguments share the available
conditions which can be applied. The conditions are:

* `ip` - (Optional) A list of IP addresses or ranges. Example:
  `ip = ["1.2.3.4", "10.0.0.0/2"]`
* `email` - (Optional) A list of email addresses. Example:
  `email = ["test@example.com"]`
* `email_domain` - (Optional) A list of email domains. Example:
  `email_domain = ["example.com"]`
* `everyone` - (Optional) Boolean indicating permitting access for all
  requests. Example: `everyone = true`

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare/blob/master/website/docs/r/access_policy.html.markdown.

applicationId.description:
The ID of the application the policy is
associated with.

decision.description:

Allowed values: `allow`, `deny`, `bypass`

full list.

includes.description:

full list.

precedence.description: The unique precedence for policies on a single application. Integer.

full list.

added.

cloudflare:index/accessRule:AccessRule.description:
Provides a Cloudflare IP Firewall Access Rule resource. Access control can be applied on basis of IP addresses, IP ranges, AS numbers or countries.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare/blob/master/website/docs/r/access_rule.html.markdown.

configuration.description: Rule configuration to apply to a matched request. It's a complex value. See description below.

mode.description: The action to apply to a matched request. Allowed values: "block", "challenge", "whitelist", "js_challenge"

notes.description: A personal note about the rule. Typically used as a reminder or explanation for the rule.

zoneId.description: The DNS zone to which the access rule should be added.

cloudflare:index/firewallRule:FirewallRu.description:
Define Firewall rules using filter expressions for more control over how traffic is matched to the rule.
A filter expression permits selecting traffic by multiple criteria allowing greater freedom in rule creation.

Filter expressions needs to be created first before using Firewall Rule. See Filter.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare/blob/master/website/docs/r/firewall_rule.markdown.

action.description: The action to apply to a matched request. Allowed values: "block", "challenge", "allow", "js_challenge", "bypass". Enterprise plan also allows "log".

description.description: A description of the rule to help identify it.

paused.description: Whether this filter based firewall rule is currently paused. Boolean value.

priority.description: The priority of the rule to allow control of processing order. A lower number indicates high priority. If not provided, any rules with a priority will be sequenced before those without.

products.description: List of products to bypass for a request when the bypass action is used. Allowed values: "zoneLockdown", "uaBlock", "bic", "hot", "securityLevel", "rateLimit", "waf".

zoneId.description: The DNS zone to which the Filter should be added.

action.description: The action to apply to a matched request. Allowed values: "block", "challenge", "allow", "js_challenge", "bypass". Enterprise plan also allows "log".

description.description: A description of the rule to help identify it.

paused.description: Whether this filter based firewall rule is currently paused. Boolean value.

priority.description: The priority of the rule to allow control of processing order. A lower number indicates high priority. If not provided, any rules with a priority will be sequenced before those without.

products.description: List of products to bypass for a request when the bypass action is used. Allowed values: "zoneLockdown", "uaBlock", "bic", "hot", "securityLevel", "rateLimit", "waf".

zoneId.description: The DNS zone to which the Filter should be added.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering FirewallRule resources.

description.description: A description of the rule to help identify it.

paused.description: Whether this filter based firewall rule is currently paused. Boolean value.

priority.description: The priority of the rule to allow control of processing order. A lower number indicates high priority. If not provided, any rules with a priority will be sequenced before those without.

products.description: List of products to bypass for a request when the bypass action is used. Allowed values: "zoneLockdown", "uaBlock", "bic", "hot", "securityLevel", "rateLimit", "waf".

zoneId.description: The DNS zone to which the Filter should be added.

cloudflare:index/loadBalancer:LoadBalanc.description:
Provides a Cloudflare Load Balancer resource. This sits in front of a number of defined pools of origins and provides various options for geographically-aware load balancing. Note that the load balancing feature must be enabled in your Clouflare account before you can use this resource.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare/blob/master/website/docs/r/load_balancer.html.markdown.

createdOn.description: The RFC3339 timestamp of when the load balancer was created.

defaultPoolIds.description: A list of pool IDs ordered by their failover priority. Used whenever region/pop pools are not defined.

description.description: Free text description.

enabled.description: Enable or disable the load balancer. Defaults to `true` (enabled).

fallbackPoolId.description: The pool ID to use when all other pools are detected as unhealthy.

modifiedOn.description: The RFC3339 timestamp of when the load balancer was last modified.

name.description: The DNS name (FQDN, including the zone) to associate with the load balancer.

popPools.description: A set containing mappings of Cloudflare Point-of-Presence (PoP) identifiers to a list of pool IDs (ordered by their failover priority) for the PoP (datacenter). This feature is only available to enterprise customers. Fields documented below.

proxied.description: Whether the hostname gets Cloudflare's origin protection. Defaults to `false`.

regionPools.description: A set containing mappings of region/country codes to a list of pool IDs (ordered by their failover priority) for the given region. Fields documented below.

sessionAffinity.description: Associates all requests coming from an end-user with a single origin. Cloudflare will set a cookie on the initial response to the client, such that consequent requests with the cookie in the request will go to the same origin, so long as it is available.  Valid values are: `""`, `"none"`, `"cookie"`, and `"ip_cookie"`.  Default is `""`.

steeringPolicy.description: Determine which method the load balancer uses to determine the fastest route to your origin. Valid values are: `"off"`, `"geo"`, `"dynamic_latency"`, `"random"` or `""`. Default is `""`.

ttl.description: Time to live (TTL) of this load balancer's DNS `name`. Conflicts with `proxied` - this cannot be set for proxied load balancers. Default is `30`.

zoneId.description: The zone ID to add the load balancer to.

defaultPoolIds.description: A list of pool IDs ordered by their failover priority. Used whenever region/pop pools are not defined.

description.description: Free text description.

enabled.description: Enable or disable the load balancer. Defaults to `true` (enabled).

fallbackPoolId.description: The pool ID to use when all other pools are detected as unhealthy.

name.description: The DNS name (FQDN, including the zone) to associate with the load balancer.

popPools.description: A set containing mappings of Cloudflare Point-of-Presence (PoP) identifiers to a list of pool IDs (ordered by their failover priority) for the PoP (datacenter). This feature is only available to enterprise customers. Fields documented below.

proxied.description: Whether the hostname gets Cloudflare's origin protection. Defaults to `false`.

regionPools.description: A set containing mappings of region/country codes to a list of pool IDs (ordered by their failover priority) for the given region. Fields documented below.

sessionAffinity.description: Associates all requests coming from an end-user with a single origin. Cloudflare will set a cookie on the initial response to the client, such that consequent requests with the cookie in the request will go to the same origin, so long as it is available.  Valid values are: `""`, `"none"`, `"cookie"`, and `"ip_cookie"`.  Default is `""`.

steeringPolicy.description: Determine which method the load balancer uses to determine the fastest route to your origin. Valid values are: `"off"`, `"geo"`, `"dynamic_latency"`, `"random"` or `""`. Default is `""`.

ttl.description: Time to live (TTL) of this load balancer's DNS `name`. Conflicts with `proxied` - this cannot be set for proxied load balancers. Default is `30`.

zoneId.description: The zone ID to add the load balancer to.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering LoadBalancer resources.

createdOn.description: The RFC3339 timestamp of when the load balancer was created.

defaultPoolIds.description: A list of pool IDs ordered by their failover priority. Used whenever region/pop pools are not defined.

description.description: Free text description.

enabled.description: Enable or disable the load balancer. Defaults to `true` (enabled).

fallbackPoolId.description: The pool ID to use when all other pools are detected as unhealthy.

modifiedOn.description: The RFC3339 timestamp of when the load balancer was last modified.

name.description: The DNS name (FQDN, including the zone) to associate with the load balancer.

popPools.description: A set containing mappings of Cloudflare Point-of-Presence (PoP) identifiers to a list of pool IDs (ordered by their failover priority) for the PoP (datacenter). This feature is only available to enterprise customers. Fields documented below.

proxied.description: Whether the hostname gets Cloudflare's origin protection. Defaults to `false`.

regionPools.description: A set containing mappings of region/country codes to a list of pool IDs (ordered by their failover priority) for the given region. Fields documented below.

sessionAffinity.description: Associates all requests coming from an end-user with a single origin. Cloudflare will set a cookie on the initial response to the client, such that consequent requests with the cookie in the request will go to the same origin, so long as it is available.  Valid values are: `""`, `"none"`, `"cookie"`, and `"ip_cookie"`.  Default is `""`.

steeringPolicy.description: Determine which method the load balancer uses to determine the fastest route to your origin. Valid values are: `"off"`, `"geo"`, `"dynamic_latency"`, `"random"` or `""`. Default is `""`.

ttl.description: Time to live (TTL) of this load balancer's DNS `name`. Conflicts with `proxied` - this cannot be set for proxied load balancers. Default is `30`.

zoneId.description: The zone ID to add the load balancer to.

allowInsecure.description: Do not validate the certificate when monitor use HTTPS. Only valid if `type` is "http" or "https".

createdOn.description: The RFC3339 timestamp of when the load balancer monitor was created.

description.description: Free text description.

expectedBody.description: A case-insensitive sub-string to look for in the response body. If this string is not found, the origin will be marked as unhealthy. Only valid if `type` is "http" or "https". Default: "".

expectedCodes.description: The expected HTTP response code or code range of the health check. Eg `2xx`. Only valid and required if `type` is "http" or "https".

followRedirects.description: Follow redirects if returned by the origin. Only valid if `type` is "http" or "https".

interval.description: The interval between each health check. Shorter intervals may improve failover time, but will increase load on the origins as we check from multiple locations. Default: 60.

method.description: The method to use for the health check. Valid values are any valid HTTP verb if `type` is "http" or "https", or `connection_established` if `type` is "tcp". Default: "GET" if `type` is "http" or "https", or "connection_established" if `type` is "tcp" .

modifiedOn.description: The RFC3339 timestamp of when the load balancer monitor was last modified.

path.description: The endpoint path to health check against. Default: "/". Only valid if `type` is "http" or "https".

retries.description: The number of retries to attempt in case of a timeout before marking the origin as unhealthy. Retries are attempted immediately. Default: 2.

timeout.description: The timeout (in seconds) before marking the health check as failed. Default: 5.

type.description: The protocol to use for the healthcheck. Currently supported protocols are 'HTTP', 'HTTPS' and 'TCP'. Default: "http".

allowInsecure.description: Do not validate the certificate when monitor use HTTPS. Only valid if `type` is "http" or "https".

description.description: Free text description.

expectedBody.description: A case-insensitive sub-string to look for in the response body. If this string is not found, the origin will be marked as unhealthy. Only valid if `type` is "http" or "https". Default: "".

expectedCodes.description: The expected HTTP response code or code range of the health check. Eg `2xx`. Only valid and required if `type` is "http" or "https".

followRedirects.description: Follow redirects if returned by the origin. Only valid if `type` is "http" or "https".

interval.description: The interval between each health check. Shorter intervals may improve failover time, but will increase load on the origins as we check from multiple locations. Default: 60.

method.description: The method to use for the health check. Valid values are any valid HTTP verb if `type` is "http" or "https", or `connection_established` if `type` is "tcp". Default: "GET" if `type` is "http" or "https", or "connection_established" if `type` is "tcp" .

path.description: The endpoint path to health check against. Default: "/". Only valid if `type` is "http" or "https".

retries.description: The number of retries to attempt in case of a timeout before marking the origin as unhealthy. Retries are attempted immediately. Default: 2.

timeout.description: The timeout (in seconds) before marking the health check as failed. Default: 5.

type.description: The protocol to use for the healthcheck. Currently supported protocols are 'HTTP', 'HTTPS' and 'TCP'. Default: "http".

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering LoadBalancerMonitor resources.

allowInsecure.description: Do not validate the certificate when monitor use HTTPS. Only valid if `type` is "http" or "https".

description.description: Free text description.

followRedirects.description: Follow redirects if returned by the origin. Only valid if `type` is "http" or "https".

interval.description: The interval between each health check. Shorter intervals may improve failover time, but will increase load on the origins as we check from multiple locations. Default: 60.

method.description: The method to use for the health check. Valid values are any valid HTTP verb if `type` is "http" or "https", or `connection_established` if `type` is "tcp". Default: "GET" if `type` is "http" or "https", or "connection_established" if `type` is "tcp" .

modifiedOn.description: The RFC3339 timestamp of when the load balancer monitor was last modified.

path.description: The endpoint path to health check against. Default: "/". Only valid if `type` is "http" or "https".

retries.description: The number of retries to attempt in case of a timeout before marking the origin as unhealthy. Retries are attempted immediately. Default: 2.

timeout.description: The timeout (in seconds) before marking the health check as failed. Default: 5.

type.description: The protocol to use for the healthcheck. Currently supported protocols are 'HTTP', 'HTTPS' and 'TCP'. Default: "http".

checkRegions.description: A list of regions (specified by region code) from which to run health checks. Empty means every Cloudflare data center (the default), but requires an Enterprise plan. Region codes can be found [here](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000540888-Load-Balancing-Geographic-Regions).

createdOn.description: The RFC3339 timestamp of when the load balancer was created.

description.description: Free text description.

enabled.description: Whether to enable (the default) this origin within the Pool. Disabled origins will not receive traffic and are excluded from health checks. The origin will only be disabled for the current pool.

minimumOrigins.description: The minimum number of origins that must be healthy for this pool to serve traffic. If the number of healthy origins falls below this number, the pool will be marked unhealthy and we will failover to the next available pool. Default: 1.

modifiedOn.description: The RFC3339 timestamp of when the load balancer was last modified.

monitor.description: The ID of the Monitor to use for health checking origins within this pool.

name.description: A human-identifiable name for the origin.

notificationEmail.description: The email address to send health status notifications to. This can be an individual mailbox or a mailing list.

origins.description: The list of origins within this pool. Traffic directed at this pool is balanced across all currently healthy origins, provided the pool itself is healthy. It's a complex value. See description below.

checkRegions.description: A list of regions (specified by region code) from which to run health checks. Empty means every Cloudflare data center (the default), but requires an Enterprise plan. Region codes can be found [here](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000540888-Load-Balancing-Geographic-Regions).

minimumOrigins.description: The minimum number of origins that must be healthy for this pool to serve traffic. If the number of healthy origins falls below this number, the pool will be marked unhealthy and we will failover to the next available pool. Default: 1.

name.description: A human-identifiable name for the origin.

origins.description: The list of origins within this pool. Traffic directed at this pool is balanced across all currently healthy origins, provided the pool itself is healthy. It's a complex value. See description below.

minimumOrigins.description: The minimum number of origins that must be healthy for this pool to serve traffic. If the number of healthy origins falls below this number, the pool will be marked unhealthy and we will failover to the next available pool. Default: 1.

destinationConf.description: Uniquely identifies a resource (such as an s3 bucket) where data will be pushed. Additional configuration parameters supported by the destination may be included. See [Logpush destination documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/logs/logpush/logpush-configuration-api/understanding-logpush-api/#destination).

logpullOptions.description: Configuration string for the Logshare API. It specifies things like requested fields and timestamp formats. See [Logpull options documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/logs/logpush/logpush-configuration-api/understanding-logpush-api/#options).

name.description: The name of the logpush job to create. Must match the regular expression `^[a-zA-Z0-9\-\.]*$`.

ownershipChallenge.description: Ownership challenge token to prove destination ownership. See [Developer documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/logs/logpush/logpush-configuration-api/understanding-logpush-api/#usage).

zoneId.description: The zone ID where the logpush job should be created.

destinationConf.description: Uniquely identifies a resource (such as an s3 bucket) where data will be pushed. Additional configuration parameters supported by the destination may be included. See [Logpush destination documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/logs/logpush/logpush-configuration-api/understanding-logpush-api/#destination).

ownershipChallenge.description: Ownership challenge token to prove destination ownership. See [Developer documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/logs/logpush/logpush-configuration-api/understanding-logpush-api/#usage).

zoneId.description: The zone ID where the logpush job should be created.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering LogpushJob resources.

See [Logpush destination documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/logs/logpush/logpush-configuration-api/understanding-logpush-api/#destination).

logpullOptions.description: Configuration string for the Logshare API. It specifies things like requested fields and timestamp formats. See [Logpull options documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/logs/logpush/logpush-configuration-api/understanding-logpush-api/#options).

name.description: The name of the logpush job to create. Must match the regular expression `^[a-zA-Z0-9\-\.]*$`.

cloudflare:index/originCaCertificate:Ori.description:
Provides a Cloudflare Origin CA certificate used to protect traffic to your origin without involving a third party Certificate Authority.

**This resource requires you use your Origin CA Key as the `api_user_service_key`.**

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare/blob/master/website/docs/r/origin_ca_certificate.html.markdown.

csr.description: The Certificate Signing Request. Must be newline-encoded.

expiresOn.description: The datetime when the certificate will expire.

hostnames.description: An array of hostnames or wildcard names bound to the certificate.

requestType.description: The signature type desired on the certificate.

requestedValidity.description: The number of days for which the certificate should be valid.

csr.description: The Certificate Signing Request. Must be newline-encoded.

hostnames.description: An array of hostnames or wildcard names bound to the certificate.

requestType.description: The signature type desired on the certificate.

requestedValidity.description: The number of days for which the certificate should be valid.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering OriginCaCertificate resources.

csr.description: The Certificate Signing Request. Must be newline-encoded.

expiresOn.description: The datetime when the certificate will expire.

hostnames.description: An array of hostnames or wildcard names bound to the certificate.

requestType.description: The signature type desired on the certificate.

requestedValidity.description: The number of days for which the certificate should be valid.

cloudflare:index/pageRule:PageRule.description:
Provides a Cloudflare page rule resource.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare/blob/master/website/docs/r/page_rule.html.markdown.

actions.description: The actions taken by the page rule, options given below.

priority.description: The priority of the page rule among others for this target, the higher the number the higher the priority as per [API documentation](https://api.cloudflare.com/#page-rules-for-a-zone-create-page-rule).

status.description: Whether the page rule is active or disabled.

target.description: The URL pattern to target with the page rule.

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to which the page rule should be added.

actions.description: The actions taken by the page rule, options given below.

priority.description: The priority of the page rule among others for this target, the higher the number the higher the priority as per [API documentation](https://api.cloudflare.com/#page-rules-for-a-zone-create-page-rule).

status.description: Whether the page rule is active or disabled.

target.description: The URL pattern to target with the page rule.

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to which the page rule should be added.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering PageRule resources.

actions.description: The actions taken by the page rule, options given below.

priority.description: The priority of the page rule among others for this target, the higher the number the higher the priority as per [API documentation](https://api.cloudflare.com/#page-rules-for-a-zone-create-page-rule).

status.description: Whether the page rule is active or disabled.

target.description: The URL pattern to target with the page rule.

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to which the page rule should be added.

cloudflare:index/rateLimit:RateLimit.description:
Provides a Cloudflare rate limit resource for a given zone. This can be used to limit the traffic you receive zone-wide, or matching more specific types of requests/responses.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare/blob/master/website/docs/r/rate_limit.html.markdown.

action.description: The action to be performed when the threshold of matched traffic within the period defined is exceeded.

bypassUrlPatterns.description: URLs matching the patterns specified here will be excluded from rate limiting.

correlate.description: Determines how rate limiting is applied. By default if not specified, rate limiting applies to the clients IP address.

description.description: A note that you can use to describe the reason for a rate limit. This value is sanitized and all tags are removed.

disabled.description: Whether this ratelimit is currently disabled. Default: `false`.

match.description: Determines which traffic the rate limit counts towards the threshold. By default matches all traffic in the zone. See definition below.

period.description: The time in seconds to count matching traffic. If the count exceeds threshold within this period the action will be performed (min: 1, max: 86,400).

threshold.description: The threshold that triggers the rate limit mitigations, combine with period. i.e. threshold per period (min: 2, max: 1,000,000).

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to apply rate limiting to.

action.description: The action to be performed when the threshold of matched traffic within the period defined is exceeded.

bypassUrlPatterns.description: URLs matching the patterns specified here will be excluded from rate limiting.

correlate.description: Determines how rate limiting is applied. By default if not specified, rate limiting applies to the clients IP address.

description.description: A note that you can use to describe the reason for a rate limit. This value is sanitized and all tags are removed.

disabled.description: Whether this ratelimit is currently disabled. Default: `false`.

match.description: Determines which traffic the rate limit counts towards the threshold. By default matches all traffic in the zone. See definition below.

period.description: The time in seconds to count matching traffic. If the count exceeds threshold within this period the action will be performed (min: 1, max: 86,400).

threshold.description: The threshold that triggers the rate limit mitigations, combine with period. i.e. threshold per period (min: 2, max: 1,000,000).

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to apply rate limiting to.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering RateLimit resources.

action.description: The action to be performed when the threshold of matched traffic within the period defined is exceeded.

bypassUrlPatterns.description: URLs matching the patterns specified here will be excluded from rate limiting.

correlate.description: Determines how rate limiting is applied. By default if not specified, rate limiting applies to the clients IP address.

description.description: A note that you can use to describe the reason for a rate limit. This value is sanitized and all tags are removed.

disabled.description: Whether this ratelimit is currently disabled. Default: `false`.

match.description: Determines which traffic the rate limit counts towards the threshold. By default matches all traffic in the zone. See definition below.

period.description: The time in seconds to count matching traffic. If the count exceeds threshold within this period the action will be performed (min: 1, max: 86,400).

threshold.description: The threshold that triggers the rate limit mitigations, combine with period. i.e. threshold per period (min: 2, max: 1,000,000).

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to apply rate limiting to.

cloudflare:index/record:Record.description:
Provides a Cloudflare record resource.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare/blob/master/website/docs/r/record.html.markdown.

createdOn.description: The RFC3339 timestamp of when the record was created

data.description: Map of attributes that constitute the record value. Primarily used for LOC and SRV record types. Either this or `value` must be specified

metadata.description: A key-value map of string metadata Cloudflare associates with the record

modifiedOn.description: The RFC3339 timestamp of when the record was last modified

name.description: The name of the record

proxiable.description: Shows whether this record can be proxied, must be true if setting `proxied=true`

proxied.description: Whether the record gets Cloudflare's origin protection; defaults to `false`.

value.description: The (string) value of the record. Either this or `data` must be specified

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to add the record to

data.description: Map of attributes that constitute the record value. Primarily used for LOC and SRV record types. Either this or `value` must be specified

name.description: The name of the record

proxied.description: Whether the record gets Cloudflare's origin protection; defaults to `false`.

value.description: The (string) value of the record. Either this or `data` must be specified

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to add the record to

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Record resources.

createdOn.description: The RFC3339 timestamp of when the record was created

data.description: Map of attributes that constitute the record value. Primarily used for LOC and SRV record types. Either this or `value` must be specified

metadata.description: A key-value map of string metadata Cloudflare associates with the record

modifiedOn.description: The RFC3339 timestamp of when the record was last modified

name.description: The name of the record

proxiable.description: Shows whether this record can be proxied, must be true if setting `proxied=true`

proxied.description: Whether the record gets Cloudflare's origin protection; defaults to `false`.

value.description: The (string) value of the record. Either this or `data` must be specified

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to add the record to

cloudflare:index/spectrumApplication:Spe.description:
Provides a Cloudflare Spectrum Application. You can extend the power of Cloudflare's DDoS, TLS, and IP Firewall to your other TCP-based services.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare/blob/master/website/docs/r/spectrum_application.html.markdown.

dns.description: The name and type of DNS record for the Spectrum application. Fields documented below.

ipFirewall.description: Enables the IP Firewall for this application. Defaults to `true`.

originDirects.description: A list of destination addresses to the origin. e.g. `tcp://192.0.2.1:22`.

originDns.description: A destination DNS addresses to the origin. Fields documented below.

originPort.description: If using `origin_dns` this is a required attribute. Origin port to proxy traffice to e.g. `22`.

protocol.description: The port configuration at Cloudflares edge. e.g. `tcp/22`.

proxyProtocol.description: Enables a proxy protocol to the origin. Valid values are: `off`, `v1`, `v2`, and `simple`. Defaults to `off`.

tls.description: TLS configuration option for Cloudflare to connect to your origin. Valid values are: `off`, `flexible`, `full` and `strict`. Defaults to `off`.

trafficType.description: Set's application type. Valid values are: `direct`, `http`, `https`.  Defaults to `direct`.

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to add the application to

dns.description: The name and type of DNS record for the Spectrum application. Fields documented below.

ipFirewall.description: Enables the IP Firewall for this application. Defaults to `true`.

originDirects.description: A list of destination addresses to the origin. e.g. `tcp://192.0.2.1:22`.

originDns.description: A destination DNS addresses to the origin. Fields documented below.

originPort.description: If using `origin_dns` this is a required attribute. Origin port to proxy traffice to e.g. `22`.

protocol.description: The port configuration at Cloudflares edge. e.g. `tcp/22`.

proxyProtocol.description: Enables a proxy protocol to the origin. Valid values are: `off`, `v1`, `v2`, and `simple`. Defaults to `off`.

tls.description: TLS configuration option for Cloudflare to connect to your origin. Valid values are: `off`, `flexible`, `full` and `strict`. Defaults to `off`.

trafficType.description: Set's application type. Valid values are: `direct`, `http`, `https`.  Defaults to `direct`.

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to add the application to

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering SpectrumApplication resources.

dns.description: The name and type of DNS record for the Spectrum application. Fields documented below.

originDirects.description: A list of destination addresses to the origin. e.g. `tcp://192.0.2.1:22`.

originDns.description: A destination DNS addresses to the origin. Fields documented below.

originPort.description: If using `origin_dns` this is a required attribute. Origin port to proxy traffice to e.g. `22`.

protocol.description: The port configuration at Cloudflares edge. e.g. `tcp/22`.

tls.description: TLS configuration option for Cloudflare to connect to your origin. Valid values are: `off`, `flexible`, `full` and `strict`. Defaults to `off`.

trafficType.description: Set's application type. Valid values are: `direct`, `http`, `https`.  Defaults to `direct`.

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to add the application to

mode.description: The mode of the group, can be one of ["on", "off"].

packageId.description: The ID of the WAF Rule Package that contains the group.

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to apply to.

mode.description: The mode of the group, can be one of ["on", "off"].

packageId.description: The ID of the WAF Rule Package that contains the group.

packageId.description: The ID of the WAF Rule Package that contains the group.

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to apply to.

actionMode.description: The action mode of the package, can be one of ["block", "challenge", "simulate"].

sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the package, can be one of ["high", "medium", "low", "off"].

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to apply to.

actionMode.description: The action mode of the package, can be one of ["block", "challenge", "simulate"].

sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the package, can be one of ["high", "medium", "low", "off"].

groupId.description: The ID of the WAF Rule Group that contains the rule.

cloudflare:index/workerRoute:WorkerRoute.description:
Provides a Cloudflare worker route resource. A route will also require a `cloudflare..WorkerScript`.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare/blob/master/website/docs/r/worker_route.html.markdown.

pattern.description:
The [route pattern](https://developers.cloudflare.com/workers/about/routes/)
* `script_name` Which worker script to run for requests that match the route pattern. If `script_name` is empty, workers will be skipped for matching requests.

zoneId.description: The zone ID to add the route to.

pattern.description:
The [route pattern](https://developers.cloudflare.com/workers/about/routes/)
* `script_name` Which worker script to run for requests that match the route pattern. If `script_name` is empty, workers will be skipped for matching requests.

zoneId.description: The zone ID to add the route to.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering WorkerRoute resources.

pattern.description:
The [route pattern](https://developers.cloudflare.com/workers/about/routes/)
* `script_name` Which worker script to run for requests that match the route pattern. If `script_name` is empty, workers will be skipped for matching requests.

zoneId.description: The zone ID to add the route to.

cloudflare:index/workerScript:WorkerScri.description:
Provides a Cloudflare worker script resource. In order for a script to be active, you'll also need to setup a `cloudflare..WorkerRoute`.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare/blob/master/website/docs/r/worker_script.html.markdown.

name.description: The name for the binding.
The name for the binding.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering WorkerScript resources.

name.description: The name for the binding.

cloudflare:index/workersKv:WorkersKv.description:
Provides a Workers KV Pair.  *NOTE:*  This resource uses the Cloudflare account APIs.  This requires setting the `CLOUDFLARE_ACCOUNT_ID` environment variable or `account_id` provider argument.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare/blob/master/website/docs/r/workers_kv.html.markdown.

namespaceId.description: The ID of the Workers KV namespace in which you want to create the KV pair

value.description: The string value to be stored in the key

namespaceId.description: The ID of the Workers KV namespace in which you want to create the KV pair

value.description: The string value to be stored in the key

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering WorkersKv resources.

value.description: The string value to be stored in the key

title.description: The name of the namespace you wish to create.
The name of the namespace you wish to create.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering WorkersKvNamespace resources.

title.description: The name of the namespace you wish to create.

jumpStart.description: Boolean of whether to scan for DNS records on creation. Ignored after zone is created. Default: false.

nameServers.description: Cloudflare-assigned name servers. This is only populated for zones that use Cloudflare DNS.

paused.description: Boolean of whether this zone is paused (traffic bypasses Cloudflare). Default: false.

plan.description: The name of the commercial plan to apply to the zone, can be updated once the one is created; one of `free`, `pro`, `business`, `enterprise`.

status.description: Status of the zone. Valid values: `active`, `pending`, `initializing`, `moved`, `deleted`, `deactivated`.

type.description: A full zone implies that DNS is hosted with Cloudflare. A partial zone is typically a partner-hosted zone or a CNAME setup. Valid values: `full`, `partial`. Default is `full`.

vanityNameServers.description:
List of Vanity Nameservers (if set).
* `meta.wildcard_proxiable` - Indicates whether wildcard DNS records can receive Cloudflare security and performance features.
* `meta.phishing_detected` - Indicates if URLs on the zone have been identified as hosting phishing content.

verificationKey.description: Contains the TXT record value to validate domain ownership. This is only populated for zones of type `partial`.

zone.description: The DNS zone name which will be added.

jumpStart.description: Boolean of whether to scan for DNS records on creation. Ignored after zone is created. Default: false.

paused.description: Boolean of whether this zone is paused (traffic bypasses Cloudflare). Default: false.

zone.description: The DNS zone name which will be added.

configurations.description: A list of IP addresses or IP ranges to match the request against specified in target, value pairs.  It's a complex value. See description below.   The order of the configuration entries is unimportant.

description.description: A description about the lockdown entry. Typically used as a reminder or explanation for the lockdown.

paused.description: Boolean of whether this zone lockdown is currently paused. Default: false.

urls.description: A list of simple wildcard patterns to match requests against. The order of the urls is unimportant.

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to which the access rule should be added.

cloudflare:index/zoneSettingsOverride:Zo.description:
Provides a resource which customizes Cloudflare zone settings. Note that after destroying this resource Zone Settings will be reset to their initial values.

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-cloudflare/blob/master/website/docs/r/zone_settings_override.html.markdown.

initialSettings.description: Settings present in the zone at the time the resource is created. This will be used to restore the original settings when this resource is destroyed. Shares the same schema as the `settings` attribute (Above).

readonlySettings.description:
Which of the current `settings` are not able to be set by the user. Which settings these are is determined by plan level and user permissions.
* `zone_status`. A full zone implies that DNS is hosted with Cloudflare. A partial zone is typically a partner-hosted zone or a CNAME setup.
* `zone_type`. Status of the zone. Valid values: active, pending, initializing, moved, deleted, deactivated.

settings.description: Settings overrides that will be applied to the zone. If a setting is not specified the existing setting will be used. For a full list of available settings see below.

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to which apply settings.

settings.description: Settings overrides that will be applied to the zone. If a setting is not specified the existing setting will be used. For a full list of available settings see below.

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to which apply settings.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering ZoneSettingsOverride resources.

initialSettings.description: Settings present in the zone at the time the resource is created. This will be used to restore the original settings when this resource is destroyed. Shares the same schema as the `settings` attribute (Above).

readonlySettings.description:
Which of the current `settings` are not able to be set by the user. Which settings these are is determined by plan level and user permissions.
* `zone_status`. A full zone implies that DNS is hosted with Cloudflare. A partial zone is typically a partner-hosted zone or a CNAME setup.
* `zone_type`. Status of the zone. Valid values: active, pending, initializing, moved, deleted, deactivated.

settings.description: Settings overrides that will be applied to the zone. If a setting is not specified the existing setting will be used. For a full list of available settings see below.

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to which apply settings.

id.description: id is the provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.
